content.description: Climb the face over a bulge, heading slightly right to get under the crack.  Pull the roof via the handcrack.  Once above the bulge, continue in the crack for 10 feet, then head up and left to a 2 bolt anchor below the cliff top.  Good rock.
content.location: This is just right around the corner from Squeeze Play, on the left end of the alcove featuring Titanic on the right end.  Start under the roof with a handcrack on the right end of it.

climbs.name: Titanic
climbs.fa: Mark Wilford, Mike Stites & Clay Frisbie 04/91

content.description: Climb the start of 'Haloween Bowl". When you arrive at the small ledge, about 15 feet from the ground, plug some gear and begin the rightward traverse to the arete where bigger holds await you. 2 bolts have recently been added to the traverse section, this is not the first time Titanic has had bolts added. It is up to you to either clip the bolts or push your comfort level as the first ascentionist's did.
content.protection: Standard rack, 2 bolts have recently been added on the traverse section.
content.location: To the left of "Stark Contrast' and 'French Kiss'. Just uphill of the Quarter Dome Boulder

content.description: Around the corner to the right of Titanic. Begin below orange plated face.  Look high for massive orange chickenhead. Aim for this. Creative, steep face climbing using excellent plates and chickenheads for pro.  The crux may surprise you.
content.protection: many nuts, pro to 3.5", Rap Anchors

content.description: Climb up into the chimney on decent rock.  This isn't climbed very often, so there may be spiderwebs.  There, the crack squeezes down to offwidth and leans left a bit.  Pull over the bulge where it squeezes down and continue to the top in the offwidth on good rock.
content.protection: Gear to the big stuff.  Rap off trees.
content.location: Just left around the corner from the huge dihedral with a slab on the left and a massive arete on the right, which is Titanic.  This is the very apparent left angling wide crack that pulls a bulge 20 feet up.

content.description: Climb through initial overhang, cruise to top on right side of arête.
content.location: Titanic area. 30 feet left of Titanic.

climbs.name: Halloween Bowl
climbs.fa: Scott Emmons, Katie Niedergeses, Erik Pohlman  10/03

content.description: Climb the face up under the roof.  Pull the roof, then head up and right into the dihedral.  Follow the lower angled dihedral to the top of the cliff.  A possible variation may be to exit the dihedral to the face on the right 10-20 feet below the top, making this somewhat harder that 5.9.
content.location: Just left of the massive hanging arete that is Titanic, this is the large dihedral.  Start about 10-15 feet left of the dihedral.

climbs.name: Black Thunder
climbs.fa: Clay Frisbie, Woody Delp, Tom Hancock

content.description: An excellent line working up a water streak. Start up a dirty left leaning flake on good holds that disappear at the third bolt. From here traverse on shallow pockets to the right edge of the water streak and enjoy precise technical movement through pockets and slopers eventually reaching jugs that lead to the anchor. Fantastic climbing, although a little dirty down low.

Climb up to the stance beneath the roof section 8 feet up.  From there, it's all offwidth for the next 15 feet.  Then, a short slab section with lichen to a tree, but below the top of the cliff.  Good rock.
content.protection: Gear to the big stuff.  Rap off trees.
content.location: Just right of the massive detached pillar, this climb is the offwidth that starts up the hill from the trail.

content.description: A mix of many types of climbing on mostly good rock.
